If someone disagrees with a point you made, theyâ€™ll likely reply â€œFTFYâ€ accompanied by a changed definition that undermines you and suits their point of view better. [2] X Research source Someone may also use â€œFTFYâ€ as a comment in a more editorial context. steps.title: Ignore their sarcastic â€œFTFYâ€ if itâ€™s mean-spirited.
steps.content: Ignore their sarcastic â€œFTFYâ€ if itâ€™s mean-spirited. If someone's â€œFTFYâ€ crosses the line from funny to offensive, itâ€™s best not to egg them on. Donâ€™t reply and delete or report the comment.

steps.title: â€œFTFYâ€ might mean â€œfull-time, first-yearâ€ in school settings.
steps.content: â€œFTFYâ€ might mean â€œfull-time, first-yearâ€ in school settings. While youâ€™re much more likely to see â€œFTFYâ€ as an abbreviation for â€œfixed that for youâ€ online, it may have an entirely different definition in an academic context. Certain universities use â€œFTFYâ€ as an initialism for freshmen and first-year students that are enrolled full-time. [10] X Research source â€œFTFYâ€ may also mean â€œfirst-time, first-yearâ€ to describe the same group of students, depending on the school. [11] X Research source
